        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

          </h1>

      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

            on

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>Run the poc.js with the release build of the v8-11.0.153.<span class="line"><!---->Run the poc.js with the release build of the v8-11.0.153.<!----></span><br>Command: `./d8 --allow-natives-syntax ./poc.js`<span class="line"><!---->Command: `./d8 --allow-natives-syntax ./poc.js`<!----></span><br><br>function opt() {<span class="line"><!---->function opt() {<!----></span><br>    const v2 = new ArrayBuffer(583987077);<span class="line"><!---->    const v2 = new ArrayBuffer(583987077);<!----></span><br>    const v4 = new DataView(v2);<span class="line"><!---->    const v4 = new DataView(v2);<!----></span><br>    let v9 = 1n;<span class="line"><!---->    let v9 = 1n;<!----></span><br>    v9 += 1n;<span class="line"><!---->    v9 += 1n;<!----></span><br>    try {<span class="line"><!---->    try {<!----></span><br>        v4.setUint8(v9);<span class="line"><!---->        v4.setUint8(v9);<!----></span><br>    } catch (v11) {<span class="line"><!---->    } catch (v11) {<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    return v9;<span class="line"><!---->    return v9;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>for (let i = 0; i < 10000; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->for (let i = 0; i &lt; 10000; i++) {<!----></span><br>    opt();<span class="line"><!---->    opt();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>opt();<span class="line"><!---->opt();<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>When running the poc.js, d8 yields the SIGTRAP.<span class="line"><!---->When running the poc.js, d8 yields the SIGTRAP.<!----></span><br>I found the bisect is "<span class="line"><!---->I found the bisect is "<!----></span>90fe7dc9ce484a4f2bae35c7aef7af0c06a7b799<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/90fe7dc9ce484a4f2bae35c7aef7af0c06a7b799"><!---->90fe7dc9ce484a4f2bae35c7aef7af0c06a7b799<!----></a>".<span class="line"><!---->".<!----></span><br><br>Before the commit, "CheckedTaggedToInt64" prevents the BigInt value reaches to "CheckedUint64Bounds" at the Simplified Lowering Phase.<span class="line"><!---->Before the commit, "CheckedTaggedToInt64" prevents the BigInt value reaches to "CheckedUint64Bounds" at the Simplified Lowering Phase.<!----></span><br>However, it disappears after the commit, and consequently, the Unreachable node becomes reachable.<span class="line"><!---->However, it disappears after the commit, and consequently, the Unreachable node becomes reachable.<!----></span><br><br>I think the below condition should be strengthened to not introduce the "TruncateBigIntToWord64" when lowering the "SpeculativeBigIntAdd".<span class="line"><!---->I think the below condition should be strengthened to not introduce the "TruncateBigIntToWord64" when lowering the "SpeculativeBigIntAdd".<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>//<span class="line"><!---->//<!----></span>https://github.com/v8/v8/blob/15c726bd630d94499ccc5b1ed39c0f24160cbf25/src/compiler/representation-change.cc#L1248-L1257<a class="undefined" target="_blank" class="line"><!---->             ((use_info.truncation().IsUsedAsWord64() &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>               (use_info.type_check() == TypeCheckKind::kBigInt ||<span class="line"><!---->           <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1404607#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jan 4, 2023, 6:05 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The expected behavior of the optimized code is deoptimizing when using a BigInt as an index and throwing an error (from CheckedTaggedToInt64). The representation changer tries to insert conversions for this case where<span class="line"><!---->The expected behavior of the optimized code is deoptimizing when using a BigInt as an index and throwing an error (from CheckedTaggedToInt64). The representation changer tries to insert conversions for this case where<!----></span><br><br>- The output node is represented in Word64 (SignedBigInt64)<span class="line"><!---->- The output node is represented in Word64 (SignedBigInt64)<!----></span><br>- The use info is CheckedSigned64AsWord64<span class="line"><!---->- The use info is CheckedSigned64AsWord64<!----></span><br><br>The representation changer first rematerializes the output node to TaggedPointer because the type check is not BigInt. Then it falls wrongly to the branch where the output representation is TaggedPointer, the output type is SignedBigInt64 in GetWord64RepresentationFor due to the previous fix I did. That's why the conversion is TruncateBigIntToWord64.<span class="line"><!---->The representation changer first rematerializes the output node to TaggedPointer because the type check is not BigInt. Then it falls wrongly to the branch where the output representation is TaggedPointer, the output type is SignedBigInt64 in GetWord64RepresentationFor due to the previous fix I did. That's why the conversion is TruncateBigIntToWord64.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to delete the two lines of code:<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to delete the two lines of code:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<span class="line"><!---->output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<!----></span><br>output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64()<span class="line"><!---->output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64()<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>We made an assumption that SignedBigInt64 and UnsignedBigInt64 cannot be represented in TaggedPointer but might be in the future. That's why the two lines of code exist. Now we have an exception when the type check is not BigInt because of the rematerialization. The two lines of code were added unnecessarily and wrongly.<span class="line"><!---->We made an assumption that SignedBigInt64 and UnsignedBigInt64 cannot be represented in TaggedPointer but might be in the future. That's why the two lines of code exist. Now we have an exception when the type check is not BigInt because of the rematerialization. The two lines of code were added unnecessarily and wrongly.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

            width: 100%;

            min-height: 0;

    <mr-app loginurl="https://accounts.google.com/AccountChooser?continue=https%3A%2F%2Fuc.appengine.google.com%2F_ah%2Fconflogin%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps%253A%252F%252Fbugs.chromium.org%252Fp%252Fchromium%252Fissues%252Fdetail%253Fid%253D1404607%2526q%253Dlabel%25253Aexternal_security_report%2526can%253D1%2526start%253D1100" logouturl="https://bugs.chromium.org/_ah/logout?continue=https://accounts.google.com/Logout%3Fcontinue%3Dhttps://uc.appengine.google.com/_ah/logout%253Fcontinue%253Dhttps://www.google.com/url%25253Fsa%25253DD%252526q%25253Dhttps://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail%2525253Fid%2525253D1404607%25252526q%2525253Dlabel%252525253Aexternal_security_report%25252526can%2525253D1%25252526start%2525253D1100%252526ust%25253D1703400960451112%252526usg%25253DAOvVaw31gp4j58WOW-tDHb9vDdDb%26service%3Dah" versionbase="https://61906-5c6a57f-dot-monorail-prod.appspot.com" projectalert=""><!---->
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }

    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }

    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }

    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }

  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>Run the poc.js with the release build of the v8-11.0.153.<span class="line"><!---->Run the poc.js with the release build of the v8-11.0.153.<!----></span><br>Command: `./d8 --allow-natives-syntax ./poc.js`<span class="line"><!---->Command: `./d8 --allow-natives-syntax ./poc.js`<!----></span><br><br>function opt() {<span class="line"><!---->function opt() {<!----></span><br>    const v2 = new ArrayBuffer(583987077);<span class="line"><!---->    const v2 = new ArrayBuffer(583987077);<!----></span><br>    const v4 = new DataView(v2);<span class="line"><!---->    const v4 = new DataView(v2);<!----></span><br>    let v9 = 1n;<span class="line"><!---->    let v9 = 1n;<!----></span><br>    v9 += 1n;<span class="line"><!---->    v9 += 1n;<!----></span><br>    try {<span class="line"><!---->    try {<!----></span><br>        v4.setUint8(v9);<span class="line"><!---->        v4.setUint8(v9);<!----></span><br>    } catch (v11) {<span class="line"><!---->    } catch (v11) {<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    return v9;<span class="line"><!---->    return v9;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>for (let i = 0; i < 10000; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->for (let i = 0; i &lt; 10000; i++) {<!----></span><br>    opt();<span class="line"><!---->    opt();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>opt();<span class="line"><!---->opt();<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>When running the poc.js, d8 yields the SIGTRAP.<span class="line"><!---->When running the poc.js, d8 yields the SIGTRAP.<!----></span><br>I found the bisect is "<span class="line"><!---->I found the bisect is "<!----></span>90fe7dc9ce484a4f2bae35c7aef7af0c06a7b799<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/90fe7dc9ce484a4f2bae35c7aef7af0c06a7b799"><!---->90fe7dc9ce484a4f2bae35c7aef7af0c06a7b799<!----></a>".<span class="line"><!---->".<!----></span><br><br>Before the commit, "CheckedTaggedToInt64" prevents the BigInt value reaches to "CheckedUint64Bounds" at the Simplified Lowering Phase.<span class="line"><!---->Before the commit, "CheckedTaggedToInt64" prevents the BigInt value reaches to "CheckedUint64Bounds" at the Simplified Lowering Phase.<!----></span><br>However, it disappears after the commit, and consequently, the Unreachable node becomes reachable.<span class="line"><!---->However, it disappears after the commit, and consequently, the Unreachable node becomes reachable.<!----></span><br><br>I think the below condition should be strengthened to not introduce the "TruncateBigIntToWord64" when lowering the "SpeculativeBigIntAdd".<span class="line"><!---->I think the below condition should be strengthened to not introduce the "TruncateBigIntToWord64" when lowering the "SpeculativeBigIntAdd".<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>//<span class="line"><!---->//<!----></span>https://github.com/v8/v8/blob/15c726bd630d94499ccc5b1ed39c0f24160cbf25/src/compiler/representation-change.cc#L1248-L1257<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/v8/v8/blob/15c726bd630d94499ccc5b1ed39c0f24160cbf25/src/compiler/representation-change.cc#L1248-L1257"><!---->https://github.com/v8/v8/blob/15c726bd630d94499ccc5b1ed39c0f24160cbf25/src/compiler/representation-change.cc#L1248-L1257<!----></a><br>  } else if (IsAnyTagged(output_rep) &&<span class="line"><!---->  } else if (IsAnyTagged(output_rep) &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>             ((use_info.truncation().IsUsedAsWord64() &&<span class="line"><!---->             ((use_info.truncation().IsUsedAsWord64() &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>               (use_info.type_check() == TypeCheckKind::kBigInt ||<span class="line"><!---->               (use_info.type_check() == TypeCheckKind::kBigInt ||<!----></span><br>                output_type.Is(Type::BigInt()))) ||<span class="line"><!---->                output_type.Is(Type::BigInt()))) ||<!----></span><br>              (use_info.type_check() == TypeCheckKind::kBigInt64 ||<span class="line"><!---->              (use_info.type_check() == TypeCheckKind::kBigInt64 ||<!----></span><br>               output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<span class="line"><!---->               output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<!----></span><br>               output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64())))) {<span class="line"><!---->               output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64())))) {<!----></span><br>    node = GetTaggedPointerRepresentationFor(node, output_rep, output_type,<span class="line"><!---->    node = GetTaggedPointerRepresentationFor(node, output_rep, output_type,<!----></span><br>                                             use_node, use_info);<span class="line"><!---->                                             use_node, use_info);<!----></span><br>    op = simplified()->TruncateBigIntToWord64();<span class="line"><!---->    op = simplified()-&gt;TruncateBigIntToWord64();<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Additional Comments:<b class="line"><!---->Additional Comments:<!----></b><br><br><br>Chrome version: <b class="line"><!---->Chrome version: <!----></b> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>Channel: <b class="line"><!---->Channel: <!----></b>Not sure<span class="line"><!---->Not sure<!----></span><br><br>OS:<b class="line"><!---->OS:<!----></b>Linux<span         by

        by

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1404607#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jan 4, 2023, 6:05 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The expected behavior of the optimized code is deoptimizing when using a BigInt as an index and throwing an error (from CheckedTaggedToInt64). The representation changer tries to insert conversions for this case where<span class="line"><!---->The expected behavior of the optimized code is deoptimizing when using a BigInt as an index and throwing an error (from CheckedTaggedToInt64). The representation changer tries to insert conversions for this case where<!----></span><br><br>- The output node is represented in Word64 (SignedBigInt64)<span class="line"><!---->- The output node is represented in Word64 (SignedBigInt64)<!----></span><br>- The use info is CheckedSigned64AsWord64<span class="line"><!---->- The use info is CheckedSigned64AsWord64<!----></span><br><br>The representation changer first rematerializes the output node to TaggedPointer because the type check is not BigInt. Then it falls wrongly to the branch where the output representation is TaggedPointer, the output type is SignedBigInt64 in GetWord64RepresentationFor due to the previous fix I did. That's why the conversion is TruncateBigIntToWord64.<span class="line"><!---->The representation changer first rematerializes the output node to TaggedPointer because the type check is not BigInt. Then it falls wrongly to the branch where the output representation is TaggedPointer, the output type is SignedBigInt64 in GetWord64RepresentationFor due to the previous fix I did. That's why the conversion is TruncateBigIntToWord64.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to delete the two lines of code:<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to delete the two lines of code:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<span class="line"><!---->output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<!----></span><br>output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64()<span class="line"><!---->output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64()<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>We made an assumption that SignedBigInt64 and UnsignedBigInt64 cannot be represented in TaggedPointer but might be in the future. That's why the two lines of code exist. Now we have an exception when the type check is not BigInt because of the rematerialization. The two lines of code were added unnecessarily and wrongly.<span class="line"><!---->We made an assumption that SignedBigInt64 and UnsignedBigInt64 cannot be represented in TaggedPointer but might be in the future. That's why the two lines of code exist. Now we have an exception when the type check is not BigInt because of the rematerialization. The two lines of code were added unnecessarily and wrongly.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

          </h1>

      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>Run the poc.js with the release build of the v8-11.0.153.<span class="line"><!---->Run the poc.js with the release build of the v8-11.0.153.<!----></span><br>Command: `./d8 --allow-natives-syntax ./poc.js`<span class="line"><!---->Command: `./d8 --allow-natives-syntax ./poc.js`<!----></span><br><br>function opt() {<span class="line"><!---->function opt() {<!----></span><br>    const v2 = new ArrayBuffer(583987077);<span class="line"><!---->    const v2 = new ArrayBuffer(583987077);<!----></span><br>    const v4 = new DataView(v2);<span class="line"><!---->    const v4 = new DataView(v2);<!----></span><br>    let v9 = 1n;<span class="line"><!---->    let v9 = 1n;<!----></span><br>    v9 += 1n;<span class="line"><!---->    v9 += 1n;<!----></span><br>    try {<span class="line"><!---->    try {<!----></span><br>        v4.setUint8(v9);<span class="line"><!---->        v4.setUint8(v9);<!----></span><br>    } catch (v11) {<span class="line"><!---->    } catch (v11) {<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    return v9;<span class="line"><!---->    return v9;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>for (let i = 0; i < 10000; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->for (let i = 0; i &lt; 10000; i++) {<!----></span><br>    opt();<span class="line"><!---->    opt();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>opt();<span class="line"><!---->opt();<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>When running the poc.js, d8 yields the SIGTRAP.<span class="line"><!---->When running the poc.js, d8 yields the SIGTRAP.<!----></span><br>I found the bisect is "<span class="line"><!---->I found the bisect is "<!----></span>90fe7dc9ce484a4f2bae35c7aef7af0c06a7b799<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/90fe7dc9ce484a4f2bae35c7aef7af0c06a7b799"><!---->90fe7dc9ce484a4f2bae35c7aef7af0c06a7b799<!----></a>".<span class="line"><!---->".<!----></span><br><br>Before the commit, "CheckedTaggedToInt64" prevents the BigInt value reaches to "CheckedUint64Bounds" at the Simplified Lowering Phase.<span class="line"><!---->Before the commit, "CheckedTaggedToInt64" prevents the BigInt value reaches to "CheckedUint64Bounds" at the Simplified Lowering Phase.<!----></span><br>However, it disappears after the commit, and consequently, the Unreachable node becomes reachable.<span class="line"><!---->However, it disappears after the commit, and consequently, the Unreachable node becomes reachable.<!----></span><br><br>I think the below condition should be strengthened to not introduce the "TruncateBigIntToWord64" when lowering the "SpeculativeBigIntAdd".<span class="line"><!---->I think the below condition should be strengthened to not introduce the "TruncateBigIntToWord64" when lowering the "SpeculativeBigIntAdd".<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>//<span class="line"><!---->//<!----></span>https://github.com/v8/v8/blob/15c726bd630d94499ccc5b1ed39c0f24160cbf25/src/compiler/representation-change.cc#L1248-L1257<a class="undefined" target="_blank" class="line"><!---->             ((use_info.truncation().IsUsedAsWord64() &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>               (use_info.type_check() == TypeCheckKind::kBigInt ||<span class="line"><!---->           Comment 4<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1404607#c4">Comment 4<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        by

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1404607#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jan 4, 2023, 6:05 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The expected behavior of the optimized code is deoptimizing when using a BigInt as an index and throwing an error (from CheckedTaggedToInt64). The representation changer tries to insert conversions for this case where<span class="line"><!---->The expected behavior of the optimized code is deoptimizing when using a BigInt as an index and throwing an error (from CheckedTaggedToInt64). The representation changer tries to insert conversions for this case where<!----></span><br><br>- The output node is represented in Word64 (SignedBigInt64)<span class="line"><!---->- The output node is represented in Word64 (SignedBigInt64)<!----></span><br>- The use info is CheckedSigned64AsWord64<span class="line"><!---->- The use info is CheckedSigned64AsWord64<!----></span><br><br>The representation changer first rematerializes the output node to TaggedPointer because the type check is not BigInt. Then it falls wrongly to the branch where the output representation is TaggedPointer, the output type is SignedBigInt64 in GetWord64RepresentationFor due to the previous fix I did. That's why the conversion is TruncateBigIntToWord64.<span class="line"><!---->The representation changer first rematerializes the output node to TaggedPointer because the type check is not BigInt. Then it falls wrongly to the branch where the output representation is TaggedPointer, the output type is SignedBigInt64 in GetWord64RepresentationFor due to the previous fix I did. That's why the conversion is TruncateBigIntToWord64.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to delete the two lines of code:<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to delete the two lines of code:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<span class="line"><!---->output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<!----></span><br>output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64()<span class="line"><!---->output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64()<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>We made an assumption that SignedBigInt64 and UnsignedBigInt64 cannot be represented in TaggedPointer but might be in the future. That's why the two lines of code exist. Now we have an exception when the type check is not BigInt because of the rematerialization. The two lines of code were added unnecessarily and wrongly.<span class="line"><!---->We made an assumption that SignedBigInt64 and UnsignedBigInt64 cannot be represented in TaggedPointer but might be in the future. That's why the two lines of code exist. Now we have an exception when the type check is not BigInt because of the rematerialization. The two lines of code were added unnecessarily and wrongly.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        mr-issue-page {

          <slot></slot>

          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>Run the poc.js with the release build of the v8-11.0.153.<span class="line"><!---->Run the poc.js with the release build of the v8-11.0.153.<!----></span><br>Command: `./d8 --allow-natives-syntax ./poc.js`<span class="line"><!---->Command: `./d8 --allow-natives-syntax ./poc.js`<!----></span><br><br>function opt() {<span class="line"><!---->function opt() {<!----></span><br>    const v2 = new ArrayBuffer(583987077);<span class="line"><!---->    const v2 = new ArrayBuffer(583987077);<!----></span><br>    const v4 = new DataView(v2);<span class="line"><!---->    const v4 = new DataView(v2);<!----></span><br>    let v9 = 1n;<span class="line"><!---->    let v9 = 1n;<!----></span><br>    v9 += 1n;<span class="line"><!---->    v9 += 1n;<!----></span><br>    try {<span class="line"><!---->    try {<!----></span><br>        v4.setUint8(v9);<span class="line"><!---->        v4.setUint8(v9);<!----></span><br>    } catch (v11) {<span class="line"><!---->    } catch (v11) {<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    return v9;<span class="line"><!---->    return v9;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>for (let i = 0; i < 10000; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->for (let i = 0; i &lt; 10000; i++) {<!----></span><br>    opt();<span class="line"><!---->    opt();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>opt();<span class="line"><!---->opt();<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>When running the poc.js, d8 yields the SIGTRAP.<span class="line"><!---->When running the poc.js, d8 yields the SIGTRAP.<!----></span><br>I found the bisect is "<span class="line"><!---->I found the bisect is "<!----></span>90fe7dc9ce484a4f2bae35c7aef7af0c06a7b799<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/90fe7dc9ce484a4f2bae35c7aef7af0c06a7b799"><!---->90fe7dc9ce484a4f2bae35c7aef7af0c06a7b799<!----></a>".<span class="line"><!---->".<!----></span><br><br>Before the commit, "CheckedTaggedToInt64" prevents the BigInt value reaches to "CheckedUint64Bounds" at the Simplified Lowering Phase.<span class="line"><!---->Before the commit, "CheckedTaggedToInt64" prevents the BigInt value reaches to "CheckedUint64Bounds" at the Simplified Lowering Phase.<!----></span><br>However, it disappears after the commit, and consequently, the Unreachable node becomes reachable.<span class="line"><!---->However, it disappears after the commit, and consequently, the Unreachable node becomes reachable.<!----></span><br><br>I think the below condition should be strengthened to not introduce the "TruncateBigIntToWord64" when lowering the "SpeculativeBigIntAdd".<span class="line"><!---->I think the below condition should be strengthened to not introduce the "TruncateBigIntToWord64" when lowering the "SpeculativeBigIntAdd".<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>//<span class="line"><!---->//<!----></span>https://github.com/v8/v8/blob/15c726bd630d94499ccc5b1ed39c0f24160cbf25/src/compiler/representation-change.cc#L1248-L1257<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/v8/v8/blob/15c726bd630d94499ccc5b1ed39c0f24160cbf25/src/compiler/representation-change.cc#L1248-L1257"><!---->https://github.com/v8/v8/blob/15c726bd630d94499ccc5b1ed39c0f24160cbf25/src/compiler/representation-change.cc#L1248-L1257<!----></a><br>  } else if (IsAnyTagged(output_rep) &&<span class="line"><!---->  } else if (IsAnyTagged(output_rep) &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>             ((use_info.truncation().IsUsedAsWord64() &&<span class="line"><!---->             ((use_info.truncation().IsUsedAsWord64() &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>               (use_info.type_check() == TypeCheckKind::kBigInt ||<span class="line"><!---->               (use_info.type_check() == TypeCheckKind::kBigInt ||<!----></span><br>                output_type.Is(Type::BigInt()))) ||<span class="line"><!---->                output_type.Is(Type::BigInt()))) ||<!----></span><br>              (use_info.type_check() == TypeCheckKind::kBigInt64 ||<span class="line"><!---->              (use_info.type_check() == TypeCheckKind::kBigInt64 ||<!----></span><br>               output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<span class="line"><!---->               output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<!----></span><br>               output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64())))) {<span class="line"><!---->               output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64())))) {<!----></span><br>    node = GetTaggedPointerRepresentationFor(node, output_rep, output_type,<span class="line"><!---->    node = GetTaggedPointerRepresentationFor(node, output_rep, output_type,<!----></span><br>                                             use_node, use_info);<span class="line"><!---->                                             use_node, use_info);<!----></span><br>    op = simplified()->TruncateBigIntToWord64();<span class="line"><!---->    op = simplified()-&gt;TruncateBigIntToWord64();<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Additional Comments:<b class="line"><!---->Additional Comments:<!----></b><br><br><br>Chrome version: <b class="line"><!---->Chrome version: <!----></b> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>Channel: <b class="line"><!---->Channel: <!----></b>Not sure<span class="line"><!---->Not sure<!----></span><br><br>OS:<b class="line"><!---->OS:<!----></b>Linux<span         by

        by

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1404607#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jan 4, 2023, 6:05 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The expected behavior of the optimized code is deoptimizing when using a BigInt as an index and throwing an error (from CheckedTaggedToInt64). The representation changer tries to insert conversions for this case where<span class="line"><!---->The expected behavior of the optimized code is deoptimizing when using a BigInt as an index and throwing an error (from CheckedTaggedToInt64). The representation changer tries to insert conversions for this case where<!----></span><br><br>- The output node is represented in Word64 (SignedBigInt64)<span class="line"><!---->- The output node is represented in Word64 (SignedBigInt64)<!----></span><br>- The use info is CheckedSigned64AsWord64<span class="line"><!---->- The use info is CheckedSigned64AsWord64<!----></span><br><br>The representation changer first rematerializes the output node to TaggedPointer because the type check is not BigInt. Then it falls wrongly to the branch where the output representation is TaggedPointer, the output type is SignedBigInt64 in GetWord64RepresentationFor due to the previous fix I did. That's why the conversion is TruncateBigIntToWord64.<span class="line"><!---->The representation changer first rematerializes the output node to TaggedPointer because the type check is not BigInt. Then it falls wrongly to the branch where the output representation is TaggedPointer, the output type is SignedBigInt64 in GetWord64RepresentationFor due to the previous fix I did. That's why the conversion is TruncateBigIntToWord64.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to delete the two lines of code:<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to delete the two lines of code:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<span class="line"><!---->output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<!----></span><br>output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64()<span class="line"><!---->output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64()<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>We made an assumption that SignedBigInt64 and UnsignedBigInt64 cannot be represented in TaggedPointer but might be in the future. That's why the two lines of code exist. Now we have an exception when the type check is not BigInt because of the rematerialization. The two lines of code were added unnecessarily and wrongly.<span class="line"><!---->We made an assumption that SignedBigInt64 and UnsignedBigInt64 cannot be represented in TaggedPointer but might be in the future. That's why the two lines of code exist. Now we have an exception when the type check is not BigInt because of the rematerialization. The two lines of code were added unnecessarily and wrongly.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
