      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>Run the poc.js with the release build of the v8-11.0.153.<span class="line"><!---->Run the poc.js with the release build of the v8-11.0.153.<!----></span><br>Command: `./d8 --allow-natives-syntax ./poc.js`<span class="line"><!---->Command: `./d8 --allow-natives-syntax ./poc.js`<!----></span><br><br>function opt() {<span class="line"><!---->function opt() {<!----></span><br>    const v2 = new ArrayBuffer(583987077);<span class="line"><!---->    const v2 = new ArrayBuffer(583987077);<!----></span><br>    const v4 = new DataView(v2);<span class="line"><!---->    const v4 = new DataView(v2);<!----></span><br>    let v9 = 1n;<span class="line"><!---->    let v9 = 1n;<!----></span><br>    v9 += 1n;<span class="line"><!---->    v9 += 1n;<!----></span><br>    try {<span class="line"><!---->    try {<!----></span><br>        v4.setUint8(v9);<span class="line"><!---->        v4.setUint8(v9);<!----></span><br>    } catch (v11) {<span class="line"><!---->    } catch (v11) {<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    return v9;<span class="line"><!---->    return v9;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>for (let i = 0; i < 10000; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->for (let i = 0; i &lt; 10000; i++) {<!----></span><br>    opt();<span class="line"><!---->    opt();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>opt();<span class="line"><!---->opt();<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>When running the poc.js, d8 yields the SIGTRAP.<span class="line"><!---->When running the poc.js, d8 yields the SIGTRAP.<!----></span><br>I found the bisect is "<span class="line"><!---->I found the bisect is "<!----></span>90fe7dc9ce484a4f2bae35c7aef7af0c06a7b799<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/90fe7dc9ce484a4f2bae35c7aef7af0c06a7b799"><!---->90fe7dc9ce484a4f2bae35c7aef7af0c06a7b799<!----></a>".<span class="line"><!---->".<!----></span><br><br>Before the commit, "CheckedTaggedToInt64" prevents the BigInt value reaches to "CheckedUint64Bounds" at the Simplified Lowering Phase.<span class="line"><!---->Before the commit, "CheckedTaggedToInt64" prevents the BigInt value reaches to "CheckedUint64Bounds" at the Simplified Lowering Phase.<!----></span><br>However, it disappears after the commit, and consequently, the Unreachable node becomes reachable.<span class="line"><!---->However, it disappears after the commit, and consequently, the Unreachable node becomes reachable.<!----></span><br><br>I think the below condition should be strengthened to not introduce the "TruncateBigIntToWord64" when lowering the "SpeculativeBigIntAdd".<span class="line"><!---->I think the below condition should be strengthened to not introduce the "TruncateBigIntToWord64" when lowering the "SpeculativeBigIntAdd".<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>//<span class="line"><!---->//<!----></span>https://github.com/v8/v8/blob/15c726bd630d94499ccc5b1ed39c0f24160cbf25/src/compiler/representation-change.cc#L1248-L1257<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/v8/v8/blob/15c726bd630d94499ccc5b1ed39c0f24160cbf25/src/compiler/representation-change.cc#L1248-L1257"><!---->https://github.com/v8/v8/blob/15c726bd630d94499ccc5b1ed39c0f24160cbf25/src/compiler/representation-change.cc#L1248-L1257<!----></a><br>  } else if (IsAnyTagged(output_rep) &&<span class="line"><!---->  } else if (IsAnyTagged(output_rep) &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>             ((use_info.truncation().IsUsedAsWord64() &&<span class="line"><!---->             ((use_info.truncation().IsUsedAsWord64() &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>               (use_info.type_check() == TypeCheckKind::kBigInt ||<span class="line"><!---->               (use_info.type_check() == TypeCheckKind::kBigInt ||<!----></span><br>                output_type.Is(Type::BigInt()))) ||<span class="line"><!---->                output_type.Is(Type::BigInt()))) ||<!----></span><br>              (use_info.type_check() == TypeCheckKind::kBigInt64 ||<span class="line"><!---->              (use_info.type_check() == TypeCheckKind::kBigInt64 ||<!----></span><br>               output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<span class="line"><!---->               output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<!----></span><br>               output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64())))) {<span class="line"><!---->               output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64())))) {<!----></span><br>    node = GetTaggedPointerRepresentationFor(node, output_rep, output_type,<span class="line"><!---->    node = GetTaggedPointerRepresentationFor(node, output_rep, output_type,<!----></span><br>                                             use_node, use_info);<span class="line"><!---->                                             use_node, use_info);<!----></span><br>    op = simplified()->TruncateBigIntToWord64();<span class="line"><!---->    op = simplified()-&gt;TruncateBigIntToWord64();<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Additional Comments:<b class="line"><!---->Additional Comments:<!----></b><br><br><br>Chrome version: <b class="line"><!---->Chrome version: <!----></b> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>Channel: <b class="line"><!---->Channel: <!----></b>Not sure<span class="line"><!---->Not sure<!----></span><br><br>OS:<b class="line"><!---->OS:<!----></b>Linux<span class="line"><!---->Linux<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Roll was in <span class="line"><!---->Roll was in <!----></span>4c5cf9d1de4eb004286f5a989aa7dbc17de26d2c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4c5cf9d1de4eb004286f5a989aa7dbc17de26d2c"><!---->4c5cf9d1de4eb004286f5a989aa7dbc17de26d2c<!----></a> rather.<span class="line"><!----> rather.<!----></span><br>Repros in ToT, also repros in <span class="line"><!---->Repros in ToT, also repros in <!----></span>f6d67ba89bf51c66ea1f685a248605d385285ffb<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/f6d67ba89bf51c66ea1f685a248605d385285ffb"><!---->f6d67ba89bf51c66ea1f685a248605d385285ffb<!----></a> which is before 11.0.153.<span class="line"><!----> which is before 11.0.153.<!----></span><br><br>So I think the bisect is incorrect.<span class="line"><!---->So I think the bisect is incorrect.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 8<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1404607#c8">Comment 8<!----></a>

          
        by

        by

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1404607#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1404607#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jan 4, 2023, 6:05 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The expected behavior of the optimized code is deoptimizing when using a BigInt as an index and throwing an error (from CheckedTaggedToInt64). The representation changer tries to insert conversions for this case where<span class="line"><!---->The expected behavior of the optimized code is deoptimizing when using a BigInt as an index and throwing an error (from CheckedTaggedToInt64). The representation changer tries to insert conversions for this case where<!----></span><br><br>- The output node is represented in Word64 (SignedBigInt64)<span class="line"><!---->- The output node is represented in Word64 (SignedBigInt64)<!----></span><br>- The use info is CheckedSigned64AsWord64<span class="line"><!---->- The use info is CheckedSigned64AsWord64<!----></span><br><br>The representation changer first rematerializes the output node to TaggedPointer because the type check is not BigInt. Then it falls wrongly to the branch where the output representation is TaggedPointer, the output type is SignedBigInt64 in GetWord64RepresentationFor due to the previous fix I did. That's why the conversion is TruncateBigIntToWord64.<span class="line"><!---->The representation changer first rematerializes the output node to TaggedPointer because the type check is not BigInt. Then it falls wrongly to the branch where the output representation is TaggedPointer, the output type is SignedBigInt64 in GetWord64RepresentationFor due to the previous fix I did. That's why the conversion is TruncateBigIntToWord64.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to delete the two lines of code:<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to delete the two lines of code:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<span class="line"><!---->output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<!----></span><br>output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64()<span class="line"><!---->output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64()<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>We made an assumption that SignedBigInt64 and UnsignedBigInt64 cannot be represented in TaggedPointer but might be in the future. That's why the two lines of code exist. Now we have an exception when the type check is not BigInt because of the rematerialization. The two lines of code were added unnecessarily and wrongly.<span class="line"><!---->We made an assumption that SignedBigInt64 and UnsignedBigInt64 cannot be represented in TaggedPointer but might be in the future. That's why the two lines of code exist. Now we have an exception when the type check is not BigInt because of the rematerialization. The two lines of code were added unnecessarily and wrongly.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;

      </style>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>Run the poc.js with the release build of the v8-11.0.153.<span class="line"><!---->Run the poc.js with the release build of the v8-11.0.153.<!----></span><br>Command: `./d8 --allow-natives-syntax ./poc.js`<span class="line"><!---->Command: `./d8 --allow-natives-syntax v9 = 1n;<!----></span><br>    v9 += 1n;<span class="line"><!---->    v9 += 1n;<!----></span><br>    try {<span class="line"><!---->    try {<!----></span><br>        v4.setUint8(v9);<span class="line"><!---->        v4.setUint8(v9);<!----></span><br>    } catch (v11) {<span class="line"><!---->    } catch (v11) {<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    return v9;<span class="line"><!---->    return v9;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>for (let i = 0; i < 10000; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->for (let i = 0; i &lt; 10000; i++) {<!----></span><br>    opt();<span class="line"><!---->    opt();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>opt();<span class="line"><!---->opt();<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>When running the poc.js, d8 yields the SIGTRAP.<span class="line"><!---->When running the poc.js, d8 yields the SIGTRAP.<!----></span><br>I found the bisect is "<span class="line"><!---->I found the bisect is "<!----></span>90fe7dc9ce484a4f2bae35c7aef7af0c06a7b799<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/90fe7dc9ce484a4f2bae35c7aef7af0c06a7b799"><!---->90fe7dc9ce484a4f2bae35c7aef7af0c06a7b799<!----></a>".<span class="line"><!---->".<!----></span><br><br>Before the commit, "CheckedTaggedToInt64" prevents the BigInt value reaches to "CheckedUint64Bounds" at the Simplified Lowering Phase.<span class="line"><!---->Before the commit, "CheckedTaggedToInt64" prevents the BigInt value reaches to "CheckedUint64Bounds" at the Simplified Lowering Phase.<!----></span><br>However, it disappears after the commit, and consequently, the Unreachable node becomes reachable.<span class="line"><!---->However, it disappears after the commit, and consequently, the Unreachable node becomes reachable.<!----></span><br><br>I think the below condition should be strengthened to not introduce the "TruncateBigIntToWord64" when lowering the "SpeculativeBigIntAdd".<span class="line"><!---->I think the below condition should be strengthened to not introduce the "TruncateBigIntToWord64" when lowering the "SpeculativeBigIntAdd".<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>//<span class="line"><!---->//<!----></span>https://github.com/v8/v8/blob/15c726bd630d94499ccc5b1ed39c0f24160cbf25/src/compiler/representation-change.cc#L1248-L1257<a class="undefined" target="_blank" class="line"><!---->             ((use_info.truncation().IsUsedAsWord64() &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>               (use_info.type_check() == TypeCheckKind::kBigInt ||<span class="line"><!---->           <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1404607#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1404607#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jan 4, 2023, 6:05 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The expected behavior of the optimized code is deoptimizing when using a BigInt as an index and throwing an error (from CheckedTaggedToInt64). The representation changer tries to insert conversions for this case where<span class="line"><!---->The expected behavior of the optimized code is deoptimizing when using a BigInt as an index and throwing an error (from CheckedTaggedToInt64). The representation changer tries to insert conversions for this case where<!----></span><br><br>- The output node is represented in Word64 (SignedBigInt64)<span class="line"><!---->- The output node is represented in Word64 (SignedBigInt64)<!----></span><br>- The use info is CheckedSigned64AsWord64<span class="line"><!---->- The use info is CheckedSigned64AsWord64<!----></span><br><br>The representation changer first rematerializes the output node to TaggedPointer because the type check is not BigInt. Then it falls wrongly to the branch where the output representation is TaggedPointer, the output type is SignedBigInt64 in GetWord64RepresentationFor due to the previous fix I did. That's why the conversion is TruncateBigIntToWord64.<span class="line"><!---->The representation changer first rematerializes the output node to TaggedPointer because the type check is not BigInt. Then it falls wrongly to the branch where the output representation is TaggedPointer, the output type is SignedBigInt64 in GetWord64RepresentationFor due to the previous fix I did. That's why the conversion is TruncateBigIntToWord64.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to delete the two lines of code:<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to delete the two lines of code:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<span class="line"><!---->output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<!----></span><br>output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64()<span class="line"><!---->output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64()<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>We made an assumption that SignedBigInt64 and UnsignedBigInt64 cannot be represented in TaggedPointer but might be in the future. That's why the two lines of code exist. Now we have an exception when the type check is not BigInt because of the rematerialization. The two lines of code were added unnecessarily and wrongly.<span class="line"><!---->We made an assumption that SignedBigInt64 and UnsignedBigInt64 cannot be represented in TaggedPointer but might be in the future. That's why the two lines of code exist. Now we have an exception when the type check is not BigInt because of the rematerialization. The two lines of code were added unnecessarily and wrongly.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>Run the poc.js with the release build of the v8-11.0.153.<span class="line"><!---->Run the poc.js with the release build of the v8-11.0.153.<!----></span><br>Command: `./d8 --allow-natives-syntax ./poc.js`<span class="line"><!---->Command: `./d8 --allow-natives-syntax class="line"><!---->        v4.setUint8(v9);<!----></span><br>    } catch (v11) {<span class="line"><!---->    } catch (v11) {<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    return v9;<span class="line"><!---->    return v9;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>for (let i = 0; i < 10000; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->for (let i = 0; i &lt; 10000; i++) {<!----></span><br>    opt();<span class="line"><!---->    opt();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>opt();<span class="line"><!---->opt();<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>When running the poc.js, d8 yields the SIGTRAP.<span class="line"><!---->When running the poc.js, d8 yields the SIGTRAP.<!----></span><br>I found the bisect is "<span class="line"><!---->I found the bisect is "<!----></span>90fe7dc9ce484a4f2bae35c7aef7af0c06a7b799<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/90fe7dc9ce484a4f2bae35c7aef7af0c06a7b799"><!---->90fe7dc9ce484a4f2bae35c7aef7af0c06a7b799<!----></a>".<span class="line"><!---->".<!----></span><br><br>Before the commit, "CheckedTaggedToInt64" prevents the BigInt value reaches to "CheckedUint64Bounds" at the Simplified Lowering Phase.<span class="line"><!---->Before the commit, "CheckedTaggedToInt64" prevents the BigInt value reaches to "CheckedUint64Bounds" at the Simplified Lowering Phase.<!----></span><br>However, it disappears after the commit, and consequently, the Unreachable node becomes reachable.<span class="line"><!---->However, it disappears after the commit, and consequently, the Unreachable node becomes reachable.<!----></span><br><br>I think the below condition should be strengthened to not introduce the "TruncateBigIntToWord64" when lowering the "SpeculativeBigIntAdd".<span class="line"><!---->I think the below condition should be strengthened to not introduce the "TruncateBigIntToWord64" when lowering the "SpeculativeBigIntAdd".<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>//<span class="line"><!---->//<!----></span>https://github.com/v8/v8/blob/15c726bd630d94499ccc5b1ed39c0f24160cbf25/src/compiler/representation-change.cc#L1248-L1257<a class="undefined" target="_blank"  } else if (IsAnyTagged(output_rep) &&<span class="line"><!---->  } else if (IsAnyTagged(output_rep) &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>             ((use_info.truncation().IsUsedAsWord64() &&<span class="line"><!---->             ((use_info.truncation().IsUsedAsWord64() &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>               (use_info.type_check() == TypeCheckKind::kBigInt ||<span class="line"><!---->               (use_info.type_check() == TypeCheckKind::kBigInt ||<!----></span><br>                output_type.Is(Type::BigInt()))) ||<span class="line"><!---->                output_type.Is(Type::BigInt()))) ||<!----></span><br>              (use_info.type_check() == TypeCheckKind::kBigInt64 ||<span class="line"><!---->              (use_info.type_check() == TypeCheckKind::kBigInt64 ||<!----></span><br>               output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<span class="line"><!---->               output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<!----></span><br>               output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64())))) {<span class="line"><!---->               output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64())))) {<!----></span><br>    node =         Roll was in <span class="line"><!---->Roll was in <!----></span>4c5cf9d1de4eb004286f5a989aa7dbc17de26d2c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/4c5cf9d1de4eb004286f5a989aa7dbc17de26d2c"><!---->4c5cf9d1de4eb004286f5a989aa7dbc17de26d2c<!----></a> rather.<span class="line"><!----> rather.<!----></span><br>Repros in ToT, also repros in <span class="line"><!---->Repros in ToT, also repros in <!----></span>f6d67ba89bf51c66ea1f685a248605d385285ffb<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/f6d67ba89bf51c66ea1f685a248605d385285ffb"><!---->f6d67ba89bf51c66ea1f685a248605d385285ffb<!----></a> which is before 11.0.153.<span class="line"><!----> which is before 11.0.153.<!----></span><br><br>So I think the bisect is incorrect.<span class="line"><!---->So I think the bisect is incorrect.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 8<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1404607#c8">Comment 8<!----></a>

          
        by

        by

          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1404607#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1404607#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jan 4, 2023, 6:05 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The expected behavior of the optimized code is deoptimizing when using a BigInt as an index and throwing an error (from CheckedTaggedToInt64). The representation changer tries to insert conversions for this case where<span class="line"><!---->The expected behavior of the optimized code is deoptimizing when using a BigInt as an index and throwing an error (from CheckedTaggedToInt64). The representation changer tries to insert conversions for this case where<!----></span><br><br>- The output node is represented in Word64 (SignedBigInt64)<span class="line"><!---->- The output node is represented in Word64 (SignedBigInt64)<!----></span><br>- The use info is CheckedSigned64AsWord64<span class="line"><!---->- The use info is CheckedSigned64AsWord64<!----></span><br><br>The representation changer first rematerializes the output node to TaggedPointer because the type check is not BigInt. Then it falls wrongly to the branch where the output representation is TaggedPointer, the output type is SignedBigInt64 in GetWord64RepresentationFor due to the previous fix I did. That's why the conversion is TruncateBigIntToWord64.<span class="line"><!---->The representation changer first rematerializes the output node to TaggedPointer because the type check is not BigInt. Then it falls wrongly to the branch where the output representation is TaggedPointer, the output type is SignedBigInt64 in GetWord64RepresentationFor due to the previous fix I did. That's why the conversion is TruncateBigIntToWord64.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to delete the two lines of code:<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to delete the two lines of code:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<span class="line"><!---->output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<!----></span><br>output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64()<span class="line"><!---->output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64()<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>We made an assumption that SignedBigInt64 and UnsignedBigInt64 cannot be represented in TaggedPointer but might be in the future. That's why the two lines of code exist. Now we have an exception when the type check is not BigInt because of the rematerialization. The two lines of code were added unnecessarily and wrongly.<span class="line"><!---->We made an assumption that SignedBigInt64 and UnsignedBigInt64 cannot be represented in TaggedPointer but might be in the future. That's why the two lines of code exist. Now we have an exception when the type check is not BigInt because of the rematerialization. The two lines of code were added unnecessarily and wrongly.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

      Steps to reproduce the problem:<b class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></b><br>Run the poc.js with the release build of the v8-11.0.153.<span class="line"><!---->Run the poc.js with the release build of the v8-11.0.153.<!----></span><br>Command: `./d8 --allow-natives-syntax ./poc.js`<span class="line"><!---->Command: `./d8 --allow-natives-syntax ./poc.js`<!----></span><br><br>function opt() {<span class="line"><!---->function opt() {<!----></span><br>    const v2 = new ArrayBuffer(583987077);<span class="line"><!---->    const v2 = new ArrayBuffer(583987077);<!----></span><br>    const v4 = new DataView(v2);<span class="line"><!---->    const v4 = new DataView(v2);<!----></span><br>    let v9 = 1n;<span class="line"><!---->    let v9 = 1n;<!----></span><br>    v9 += 1n;<span class="line"><!---->    v9 += 1n;<!----></span><br>    try {<span class="line"><!---->    try {<!----></span><br>        v4.setUint8(v9);<span class="line"><!---->        v4.setUint8(v9);<!----></span><br>    } catch (v11) {<span class="line"><!---->    } catch (v11) {<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>    return v9;<span class="line"><!---->    return v9;<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br><br>for (let i = 0; i < 10000; i++) {<span class="line"><!---->for (let i = 0; i &lt; 10000; i++) {<!----></span><br>    opt();<span class="line"><!---->    opt();<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>opt();<span class="line"><!---->opt();<!----></span><br><br>Problem Description:<b class="line"><!---->Problem Description:<!----></b><br>When running the poc.js, d8 yields the SIGTRAP.<span class="line"><!---->When running the poc.js, d8 yields the SIGTRAP.<!----></span><br>I found the bisect is "<span class="line"><!---->I found the bisect is "<!----></span>90fe7dc9ce484a4f2bae35c7aef7af0c06a7b799<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/90fe7dc9ce484a4f2bae35c7aef7af0c06a7b799"><!---->90fe7dc9ce484a4f2bae35c7aef7af0c06a7b799<!----></a>".<span class="line"><!---->".<!----></span><br><br>Before the commit, "CheckedTaggedToInt64" prevents the BigInt value reaches to "CheckedUint64Bounds" at the Simplified Lowering Phase.<span class="line"><!---->Before the commit, "CheckedTaggedToInt64" prevents the BigInt value reaches to "CheckedUint64Bounds" at the Simplified Lowering Phase.<!----></span><br>However, it disappears after the commit, and consequently, the Unreachable node becomes reachable.<span class="line"><!---->However, it disappears after the commit, and consequently, the Unreachable node becomes reachable.<!----></span><br><br>I think the below condition should be strengthened to not introduce the "TruncateBigIntToWord64" when lowering the "SpeculativeBigIntAdd".<span class="line"><!---->I think the below condition should be strengthened to not introduce the "TruncateBigIntToWord64" when lowering the "SpeculativeBigIntAdd".<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>//<span class="line"><!---->//<!----></span>https://github.com/v8/v8/blob/15c726bd630d94499ccc5b1ed39c0f24160cbf25/src/compiler/representation-change.cc#L1248-L1257<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/v8/v8/blob/15c726bd630d94499ccc5b1ed39c0f24160cbf25/src/compiler/representation-change.cc#L1248-L1257"><!---->https://github.com/v8/v8/blob/15c726bd630d94499ccc5b1ed39c0f24160cbf25/src/compiler/representation-change.cc#L1248-L1257<!----></a><br>  } else if (IsAnyTagged(output_rep) &&<span class="line"><!---->  } else if (IsAnyTagged(output_rep) &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>             ((use_info.truncation().IsUsedAsWord64() &&<span class="line"><!---->             ((use_info.truncation().IsUsedAsWord64() &amp;&amp;<!----></span><br>               (use_info.type_check() == TypeCheckKind::kBigInt ||<span class="line"><!---->               (use_info.type_check() == TypeCheckKind::kBigInt ||<!----></span><br>                output_type.Is(Type::BigInt()))) ||<span class="line"><!---->                output_type.Is(Type::BigInt()))) ||<!----></span><br>              (use_info.type_check() == TypeCheckKind::kBigInt64 ||<span class="line"><!---->              (use_info.type_check() == TypeCheckKind::kBigInt64 ||<!----></span><br>               output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<span class="line"><!---->               output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<!----></span><br>               output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64())))) {<span class="line"><!---->               output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64())))) {<!----></span><br>    node = GetTaggedPointerRepresentationFor(node, output_rep, output_type,<span class="line"><!---->    node = GetTaggedPointerRepresentationFor(node, output_rep, output_type,<!----></span><br>                                             use_node, use_info);<span class="line"><!---->                                             use_node, use_info);<!----></span><br>    op = simplified()->TruncateBigIntToWord64();<span class="line"><!---->    op = simplified()-&gt;TruncateBigIntToWord64();<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>Additional Comments:<b class="line"><!---->Additional Comments:<!----></b><br><br><br>Chrome version: <b class="line"><!---->Chrome version: <!----></b> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>Channel: <b class="line"><!---->Channel: <!----></b>Not sure<span class="line"><!---->Not sure<!----></span><br><br>OS:<b class="line"><!---->OS:<!----></b>Linux<span           Comment 18<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1404607#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden="">schedule</i>
      panq@google.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/3935111142" title="panq@google.com"><!---->panq@google.com<!----></a>
      panq@google.com<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->panq@google.com<!----></span>
      Last visit > 30 days ago<div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="Last visit > 30 days ago" hidden=""><!---->Last visit &gt; 30 days ago<!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Wed, Jan 4, 2023, 6:05 AM EST
    <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jan 4, 2023, 6:05 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1404607#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jan 4, 2023, 6:05 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1404607#c18">Comment 18<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Wed, Jan 4, 2023, 6:05 AM EST"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
      
        
          Status:<strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Started
          (was: Assigned)
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        The expected behavior of the optimized code is deoptimizing when using a BigInt as an index and throwing an error (from CheckedTaggedToInt64). The representation changer tries to insert conversions for this case where<span class="line"><!---->The expected behavior of the optimized code is deoptimizing when using a BigInt as an index and throwing an error (from CheckedTaggedToInt64). The representation changer tries to insert conversions for this case where<!----></span><br><br>- The output node is represented in Word64 (SignedBigInt64)<span class="line"><!---->- The output node is represented in Word64 (SignedBigInt64)<!----></span><br>- The use info is CheckedSigned64AsWord64<span class="line"><!---->- The use info is CheckedSigned64AsWord64<!----></span><br><br>The representation changer first rematerializes the output node to TaggedPointer because the type check is not BigInt. Then it falls wrongly to the branch where the output representation is TaggedPointer, the output type is SignedBigInt64 in GetWord64RepresentationFor due to the previous fix I did. That's why the conversion is TruncateBigIntToWord64.<span class="line"><!---->The representation changer first rematerializes the output node to TaggedPointer because the type check is not BigInt. Then it falls wrongly to the branch where the output representation is TaggedPointer, the output type is SignedBigInt64 in GetWord64RepresentationFor due to the previous fix I did. That's why the conversion is TruncateBigIntToWord64.<!----></span><br><br>The fix is to delete the two lines of code:<span class="line"><!---->The fix is to delete the two lines of code:<!----></span><br><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br>output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<span class="line"><!---->output_type.Is(Type::SignedBigInt64()) ||<!----></span><br>output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64()<span class="line"><!---->output_type.Is(Type::UnsignedBigInt64()<!----></span><br>```<span class="line"><!---->```<!----></span><br><br>We made an assumption that SignedBigInt64 and UnsignedBigInt64 cannot be represented in TaggedPointer but might be in the future. That's why the two lines of code exist. Now we have an exception when the type check is not BigInt because of the rematerialization. The two lines of code were added unnecessarily and wrongly.<span class="line"><!---->We made an assumption that SignedBigInt64 and UnsignedBigInt64 cannot be represented in TaggedPointer but might be in the future. That's why the two lines of code exist. Now we have an exception when the type check is not BigInt because of the rematerialization. The two lines of code were added unnecessarily and wrongly.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

          Comment 22<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1404607#c22">Comment 22<!----></a>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
